a.title: Go to comments for Mrs. R

span.strong: The Current edition of The Bear Pride Newsletter is now available on-line. Please click on the following link to view the current issue:

p.span: We will be distrubiting Chromebooks and collecting packets for grades K-5 Monday. Drop off/pickup will be 10:00-11:00 for grades K-2, and 11:00-12:00 grades 3-5. The procedure will be the same as the last packet pickup. Please remain in your car, we ask parents to put packets in the boxes for us, we will hand you your chromebook. If you have not reached out to your child's teacher or did not answer the call from your child's teacher, you will not be getting a Chromebook Monday. If you need a Chromebook after Monday, please let your child's teacher know. If your child received a packet we will notify you in two weeks for the collection process, if you can not come during those hours you may have someone else pick up chromebook/packets.

a.title: Go to comments for Elem. Chromebooks

p.span: School will be continuing with home instruction until May 1st when the Governor will assess the situation. As we meet through the week we will update you with any changes in instruction. Please refer to FB, all calls and the Leetonia School Website. Thank you again as we work through this together.

a.title: Go to comments for Continuing Home Instruction

p.span: Let's have some fun and join the Bear Hunt and show our Bear Pride during this stay at home order. Simply place a stuffed bear in your window so kids can hunt for them while on family walks or drives through the neighborhood. If you dont have a bear you can always color one and place it in the window. Send pictures of your bear in the window to Mrs. Gibson for the webpage: agibson@leetonia.k12.oh.us

a.title: Go to comments for Bear Hunt

p.span: After consultation with the Ohio Department of Health, Ohio Governor Mike DeWine has required all schools to be closed beginning Monday, March 16 through Friday, April 3, 2020.

span.strong: Following a countywide meeting with Wesley Vins, Columbiana County Health Commissioner, and the local school superintendents, the following listed recommendations will be effective immediately:
All out-of-state field trips are cancelled.
All indoor student performances and mass gatherings open to the public will be cancelled.
All athletic events, including practices are cancelled.
Additional guidance from Ohio High School Athletic Association (ohsaa.org) will be monitored.
Districts and schools should prepare in the event that schools are closed and remote learning is necessary.

span.span: Parents should prepare for their childrens instruction to begin

p.span: It is also important to note that as of this writing, there are no confirmed cases of COVID-19 in Columbiana County. This is a rapidly evolving situation, and one that is being monitored closely. Schools in Columbiana County have previously developed emergency operation plans that specifically address how to deal with a large-scale illness outbreak, including procedures for excluding ill students and staff, cancellation of activities and mass gatherings, and, if necessary, school closure. Practicing good hygiene can help to limit the spread of viruses in our schools. Custodial staff will continue to regularly clean and disinfect classrooms and common areas.
We will continue to stress the recommended precautions to avoid exposure to the virus, which are the same precautions you would take to avoid the flu. To keep your family safe:

strong.em: Wash your hands often with soap and water for at least 20 seconds. If soap and water are not available, use an alcohol-based hand sanitizer.

span.strong: Avoid touching your eyes, nose, and mouth with unwashed hands.
Stay home when you are sick and do not return to school or work until you have been fever-free without the use of fever reducing medication for at least 24 hours.
Cover your sneezes or coughs with a tissue and then throw the tissue in the trash; if tissues arent available, sneeze or cough into the inside of your elbow.
Clean and disinfect frequently touched objects and surfaces.

br.span: We will be continuing our partnerships with public health experts and updating you when new relevant information is available. You may find additional information here:

span.span: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention:

a.title: Go to comments for Coronavirus UPDATE

p.span: Just a reminder that any bus changes need to be approved by the school Prior to the change. Please notify the school office so that a Bus Pass will be issued to your student. A written note or phone call from a parent or guardian is required for all changes.

a.title: Go to comments for Bus Reminder

span.strong: Please click on link for more information

a.title: Go to comments for Sub Drivers Needed

a.title: Go to comments for SELFIES WANTED: 2020 YSN SENIOR SPORTS SEND-OFF

div.span: Each year senior students look forward to seeing their years of hard work and sacrifice pay off with events like prom, graduation, our scholarship dinner, and for other spring activities as well as many other memory-filled moments. We understand that this is an uncertain time, resulting in many events and activities being postponed. Please know that we are committed to hosting prom and graduation at some point. No calendar changes have been made thus far. We will keep you up to date. We are determined to make sure that memories are still made for the Leetonia Class of 2020!

a.title: Go to comments for Letter to Seniors

span.p: Please click the link below for information on ordering yearbooks and placing a Senior ad in the yearbook. Any questions please contact Mrs. Hull @ ghull@leetonia.k12.oh.us
Seniors don't forget to send in your Senor pictures and Baby pictures for the yearbook!

a.title: Go to comments for Yearbook Forms
Go to comments for Parent tips

em.span: In everything we do, the safety of our students and staff is our top concern. In light of that, we want to share an important message about the coronavirus (COVID-19) illness. With the virus now spreading outside its origins in China, federal health officials are preparing for a likely outbreak in the United States. The District is monitoring the situation closely and is taking direction from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), Ohio Department of Health and the Columbiana County Board of Health regarding mitigation procedures.

We are asking parents to help in the effort to minimize the spread of this type of virus by having your family follow the recommendations from the CDC, which are the same ones that everyone should practice during flu season:
Cover your nose and mouth: When coughing or sneezing cover with a tissue or by using your sleeve or elbow
Avoid touching eyes, nose and mouth
Stay home when sick and dont return to school for at least 24 hours of being fever-free without the use of medication.

In addition, the school district is following recommendations from the CDC to daily clean areas and equipment frequently touched by students and staff, and encourage students to wash hands often. In addition, we will be adding extra hand sanitation dispensers in our cafeterias.
We also encourage parents to report if their child has a confirmed case of the flu to help us track viral infections and to better target our sanitizing efforts.
If we do experience COVID-19 cases, we will take our direction from the CDC, Ohio Department of Health and Columbiana Board of Health regarding potential school closings.

a.title: Go to comments for Coronavirus Saftey

span.strong: Policies and guidelines regarding the identification, evaluation, or placement of students with disabilities have been updated. This includes students on IEPs and 504 Plans. A link to the policies is located below. For any additional information contact the Board Office.
